trans-unit.source: Zero-based vs. One-based String Access in Visual Basic | Microsoft Docs
trans-unit.target: De base cero. Acceso basado en una cadena en Visual Basic | Documentos de Microsoft

trans-unit.source: Zero-based vs. One-based String Access in Visual Basic
trans-unit.target: De base cero. Acceso basado en una cadena en Visual Basic

trans-unit.source: This topic compares how [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](../../../../csharp/programming-guide/concepts/linq/includes/vbprvb_md.md)] and the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](../../../../csharp/getting-started/includes/dnprdnshort_md.md)] provide access to the characters in a string.
trans-unit.target: Este tema se compara cómo [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](../../../../csharp/programming-guide/concepts/linq/includes/vbprvb_md.md)] y [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](../../../../csharp/getting-started/includes/dnprdnshort_md.md)] proporcionan acceso a los caracteres de una cadena.

trans-unit.source: The [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](../../../../csharp/getting-started/includes/dnprdnshort_md.md)] always provides zero-based access to the characters in a string, whereas [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](../../../../csharp/programming-guide/concepts/linq/includes/vbprvb_md.md)] provides zero-based and one-based access, depending on the function.
trans-unit.target: El [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](../../../../csharp/getting-started/includes/dnprdnshort_md.md)] siempre proporciona acceso basado en cero a los caracteres de una cadena, mientras que [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](../../../../csharp/programming-guide/concepts/linq/includes/vbprvb_md.md)] proporciona acceso basado en cero y basado en uno, dependiendo de la función.

trans-unit.source: One-Based
trans-unit.target: Basado en uno

trans-unit.source: For an example of a one-based [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](../../../../csharp/programming-guide/concepts/linq/includes/vbprvb_md.md)] function, consider the `Mid` function.
trans-unit.target: Para obtener un ejemplo de base uno [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](../../../../csharp/programming-guide/concepts/linq/includes/vbprvb_md.md)] función, considere la `Mid` (función).

trans-unit.source: It takes an argument that indicates the character position at which the substring will start, starting with position 1.
trans-unit.target: Toma un argumento que indica la posición del carácter en el que comenzará la subcadena, empezando por la posición 1.

trans-unit.source: The [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](../../../../csharp/getting-started/includes/dnprdnshort_md.md)] <xref:System.String.Substring%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method takes an index of the character in the string at which the substring is to start, starting with position 0.
trans-unit.target: El [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](../../../../csharp/getting-started/includes/dnprdnshort_md.md)] <xref:System.String.Substring%2A?displayProperty=fullName>método toma un índice del carácter de la cadena en la que la subcadena debe iniciar, empezando por la posición 0.</xref:System.String.Substring%2A?displayProperty=fullName>

trans-unit.source: Thus, if you have a string "ABCDE", the individual characters are numbered 1,2,3,4,5 for use with the `Mid` function, but 0,1,2,3,4 for use with the <xref:System.String.Substring%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
trans-unit.target: Por lo tanto, si tiene una cadena "ABCDE", los caracteres individuales se numeran 1,2,3,4,5 para su uso con el `Mid` función, pero 0,1,2,3,4 para su uso con el <xref:System.String.Substring%2A?displayProperty=fullName>método.</xref:System.String.Substring%2A?displayProperty=fullName>

trans-unit.source: Zero-Based
trans-unit.target: Basado en cero

trans-unit.source: For an example of a zero-based [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](../../../../csharp/programming-guide/concepts/linq/includes/vbprvb_md.md)] function, consider the `Split` function.
trans-unit.target: Para obtener un ejemplo basado en cero [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](../../../../csharp/programming-guide/concepts/linq/includes/vbprvb_md.md)] función, considere la `Split` (función).

trans-unit.source: It splits a string and returns an array containing the substrings.
trans-unit.target: Divide una cadena y devuelve una matriz que contiene las subcadenas.

trans-unit.source: The [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](../../../../csharp/getting-started/includes/dnprdnshort_md.md)] <xref:System.String.Split%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method also splits a string and returns an array containing the substrings.
trans-unit.target: El [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](../../../../csharp/getting-started/includes/dnprdnshort_md.md)] <xref:System.String.Split%2A?displayProperty=fullName>método también divide una cadena y devuelve una matriz que contiene las subcadenas.</xref:System.String.Split%2A?displayProperty=fullName>

trans-unit.source: Because the `Split` function and <xref:System.String.Split%2A> method return [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](../../../../csharp/getting-started/includes/dnprdnshort_md.md)] arrays, they must be zero-based.
trans-unit.target: Dado que la `Split` (función) y <xref:System.String.Split%2A>método devuelven [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](../../../../csharp/getting-started/includes/dnprdnshort_md.md)] matrices, deben ser basado en cero.</xref:System.String.Split%2A>

trans-unit.target: Vea también
